intro: Polycodium interius var. commune, commonly known as the common polycodium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of greenish-white to yellow, which bloom in early summer. Its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported tonic properties. The species is characterized by its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
